channel.title: Bladder cancer on Urologist | Dr. Yen-Ting Wu

item.title: New Milestone in the Treatment of Late-Stage Urothelial Carcinoma
item.description: What is Urothelial Carcinoma? Urothelial carcinoma refers to cancer that grows on the mucosa of the urinary system (renal collecting system, ureters, bladder), and the most common symptom is usually hematuria.

item.title: What is a cystoscope?
item.description: What is a cystoscope? Similar to endoscopes for other organs such as panendoscopes for examining the stomach and small intestine, and colonoscopes for examining the rectum and colon, a cystoscope is used to inspect the urethra and bladder.
